sentences: Thotagamage Shelton Perera (20 March 1939 – 18 September 1986), was a Sri Lankan musician and a singer.
Shelton Perera was born on 20 March 1939 in Colombo as the second of the family.
She won gold medals for her role as "Princess Chintamani" in the play Chintamani in 1935 and for the role of "Kumarihami" in the play Ehelepola in 1937.
Shelton had one elder brother, Arthur.
Youngest sister Kumari Perera is a stage actress as well as one of the first presenters on National Television.
